citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Enclosures are not being spot cleaned daily. There was a build up of feces in multiple indoor boxes that needs to be
removed. Fecal and food waste must be removed from primary enclosures daily to prevent soiling of the dogs and reduce
odors.
Correct by: April 25, 2024

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
Primary enclosures are not being cleaned and sanitized at least once every two weeks. There is a build up of hair hanging
down from the wire mesh floor. This accumulation of hair traps urine, dust and debris in and around the primary
enclosures. In addition, there is feces and hair trapped between wire mesh and the wood support beams around the
outdoor enclosures. These primary enclosures must be cleaned and sanitized at least once every two weeks for the
health of the dogs.
Correct by: May 1, 2024

The facility has two cavalier puppies that are 5 months of age. According to the vaccine schedule established by the
veterinarian, they should have had their first rabies vaccine at 3 months of age. These dogs must be vaccinated per the
schedule established by the attending veterinarian for their health and well being and to ensure she has adequate
authority over preventative health of the kennel.
Correct by: May 1, 2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
n

narrative:
3.11(a) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Enclosures are not being spot cleaned daily. There was a build up of feces in multiple indoor boxes that needs to be 
removed. Fecal and food waste must be removed from primary enclosures daily to prevent soiling of the dogs and reduce 
odors.  
Correct by: April 25, 2024 
3.11(b)(2) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
Primary enclosures are not being cleaned and sanitized at least once every two weeks. There is a build up of hair hanging 
down from the wire mesh floor. This accumulation of hair traps urine, dust and debris in and around the primary 
enclosures. In addition, there is feces and hair trapped between wire mesh and the wood support beams around the 
outdoor enclosures. These primary enclosures must be cleaned and sanitized at least once every two weeks for the 
health of the dogs.  
Correct by: May 1, 2024 
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The facility has two cavalier puppies that are 5 months of age. According to the vaccine schedule established by the 
veterinarian, they should have had their first rabies vaccine at 3 months of age. These dogs must be vaccinated per the 
schedule established by the attending veterinarian for their health and well being and to ensure she has adequate 
authority over preventative health of the kennel.  
Correct by: May 1, 2024 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the licensee.
